alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Fergus County through 415 PM MDT... At 355 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Roy, or 17 miles east of Lewistown, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and hail up to one half inch in diameter, along with brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Fergus County. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 96 and 117. Highway 191 between mile markers 37 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized minor flooding of streets, small creeks, and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
